content: The [Singapore Ministry of Manpower](/wiki/Ministry_of_Manpower_(Singapore)) is the responsible authority for [occupational safety and health](/wiki/Occupational_safety_and_health) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). The [Workplace Safety and Health Act](/wiki/Workplace_Safety_and_Health_Act) 2006 addresses requirements for [safety and health in workplaces](/wiki/Occupational_safety_and_health) in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) and replaced the Factories Act as of 1 March 2006. The [Workplace Safety and Health Council](/wiki/Workplace_Safety_and_Health_Council) is an industry-led Statutory Body that was formed on 1 April 2008. This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Workplace safety and health in Singapore
